e4: While current policy may lead to less immediate and obvious issues, transparency in reporting promotes higher integrity. Adopting transparent policy also encourages greater public trust overall.
e5: An ethical accounting policy prioritizes transparency and truthfulness, accurately reflecting the company's true financial position and performance, without intentional misdirection or manipulation. This necessitates a complete and clear divulgence of all relevant details, free from biases and manipulations intended for any segment. It promotes accountability and investor trust, making informed calculations based on accurate information rather than preconceived assumptions.
e6: Have you considered exploring alternative strategies, such as issuing corrected quarterly reports or performing a one-time, detailed financial disclosure, instead of adopting an annual policy change?
